summary.p: The Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ Cūṭāmaṇi, also known as Cūṭāmaṇi Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ and Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ, is a work on astrology by Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ (possibly 12th or 13th century according to Zvelebil 1995, p. 720). It is not to be confused with the homonym work by Maṇṭalapuruṭaṉ. See Sweetman (2012, p. 95).
The work (mūlam & urai) is apparently incomplete.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (February 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Double folio. 465 x 40 mm. Verso blank. Hand #1. Added to the original manuscript (along with U3).
18 folios = Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ Cūṭāmaṇi. 465 x 45 mm. Hand #2 (f1-f17r). Hand #3 (f17r-f18).
Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ Cūṭāmaṇi: Invocation (?). No foliation. Verso blank.
17 folios = Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ Cūṭāmaṇi: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation {1}-3, 5-18. f18v blank.
1 folio = back guard leaf. Double folio. 455 x 40 mm. Blank recto verso. Added to the original manuscript (along with U1).

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation despite boreholes.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 90 (front cover, recto).
BnF stamp DON N° (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 427 (f[1]r).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson (1868) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cūṭāmaṇi Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ uraiyuṭaṉ (cōtiṭa nūl). Ed. by Cattiyapāmā Kāmēsvaraṉ. Tañcāvūr: Tañcāvūr Makārājā Carapōjiyiṉ Caracuvati Makāl Nūlakam. 2007.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 17.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. “La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry.” In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Sweetman, Will & R. Ilakkuvan. 2012. The Bibliotheca Malabarica: Bartholomäus Ziegenbalg’s Tamil Library: An Annotated edition and translation. Pondicherry: EFEO and IFP. (Indologie no. 119).

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 25.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
